How about the heater, fan, air conditioning or dehumidifer switching on or =

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com

  =
    
      


To Add:
=A0
To me being present when it happened, these 
taps=
 sounded like breaker switches-you know when you overload the circuits in 
=
your home=A0and one of the switches in the electrical panel will trip? That=
 
is what it sounded like. A sharp, semi metallic snap.
=A0
This is why I t=
hought maybe it could be 
faulty breakers, though no switches were actually=
 switched. It could be, as 
someone suggested earlier some electrical appar=
atus in the home making the noise 
every time there is a surge.=A0I did try=
 and=A0track it down, but could 
not find the source.=A0I have a sleep numb=
er bed. Every time anything goes on 
with the power, it makes a noise-thoug=
h not like this.
=A0

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: 
  April Aber=
crombie 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
  Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 10:=
32 
  AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Tap 
sound
  

  
  
  
  There is ab=
solutely no evidence pointing 
  towards PK phenomena. The homeowners were =
not present during the 
  investigation. These surges=A0can 
  easily be ex=
plained=A0as mundane and therefore we must assume it is. 
  If we can't rul=
e out all mundane 
  sources, then we have to assume it is not paranormal.
=
  =A0
  These were electrical surges. The only 
  time we had EMF spikes wa=
s when these taps would be heard. The meter would 
  spike, and then immedi=
ately return to 0.
  =A0
  "Do your readings in your notes? Were you readin=
g electrical or 
  magnetic
fields? What type of EMF meter were you using?"=

  =A0
  Yes we logged all readings. We were 
  reading EMF, so a bit of bo=
th. We had several types of meters present. At one 
  point, we had 2 KII m=
eters a few feet apart in the living room. On=A0some 
  taps, one would go =
off, and others, the other one would go off. Most spikes 
  fell in the 2.5=
 mg range, but a couple went off the scale.
  =A0
  It also explains some o=
f the other 
  activity the homeowners complained about-the touch lamp, kit=
chen lights 
  dimming, etc.
  =A0
  Again, these surges were constant, tho=
ugh 
  not uniform.
  =A0
  April
  =A0

    What I have been hearing on this since the first posting i=
s a 
    single
tap that sounds like wood on wood. Since the tapping was 
 =
   continual
and you noticed an EM spike there is another 
    possibility.=


You could have detected a PK event. In poltergeist cases 
    we have com=
e
to realize that living PK agents often are responsible. 
    These agents=

function in environments with specific characteristics and 
    themselves=

exhibit specific traits. One of the environmental 
    characteristics is
=
an elevated magnetic field. Often this is a 
    geomagnetic field as seems=

to be the case in extreme poltergeist cases. 
    Less extremem cases, 
su=
ch as this may be, we often see elevated EM field 
    levels. Do your
read=
ings in your notes? Were you reading electrical or 
    magnetic
fields? Wh=
at type of EMF meter were you using? This might 
    help
determine if the =
info you noticed was potentially related to 
    PK
effects.
